channel.title: CVE Feed for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiOS, FortiProxy
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiOS, FortiProxy

item.title: CVE-2021-26110|2024-08-03T20:19:20.350Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortios%2C%20fortiproxy
item.description: An improper access control vulnerability [CWE-284] in FortiOS autod daemon 7.0.0, 6.4.6 and below, 6.2.9 and below, 6.0.12 and below and FortiProxy 2.0.1 and below, 1.2.9 and below may allow an authenticated low-privileged attacker to escalate their privileges to super_admin via a specific crafted configuration of fabric automation CLI script and auto-script features.

item.title: CVE-2022-29055|2024-08-03T06:10:59.155Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortios%2C%20fortiproxy
item.description: A access of uninitialized pointer in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.2.0, 7.0.0 through 7.0.5, 6.4.0 through 6.4.8, 6.2.0 through 6.2.10, 6.0.x, FortiProxy version 7.0.0 through 7.0.4, 2.0.0 through 2.0.9, 1.2.x allows a remote unauthenticated or authenticated attacker to crash the sslvpn daemon via an HTTP GET request.

item.title: CVE-2021-26092|2024-08-03T20:19:19.466Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortios%2C%20fortiproxy
item.description: Failure to sanitize input in the SSL VPN web portal of FortiOS 5.2.10 through 5.2.15, 5.4.0 through 5.4.13, 5.6.0 through 5.6.14, 6.0.0 through 6.0.12, 6.2.0 through 6.2.7, 6.4.0 through 6.4.4; and FortiProxy 1.2.0 through 1.2.9, 2.0.0 through 2.0.1 may allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to perform a reflected Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attack by sending a request to the error page with malicious GET parameters.
